summary: Male and Female Dragon Priest Armor with Cloth, Light and Heavy versions for crafting and enchanting.
descriptionHtml:
[center][b][color=#ff7700][size=5][u]ATTENTION![/u]
My user is lost forever, so if you wanna send me a message send it for OverlordBR![/size][/color][/b][/center]

[b][color=#FF6600]This is a remake version from the Dragon Priests Armor by Backsteppo[/color][/b]

[b]So why remake what has already been done?[/b]
I have been waiting a long time for Backsteppo to make new versions of his mod, that the itens match in type of armor.
So i went into the creation kit and start making it by myself.

This mod meant to be an upgrade of an old mod, making Dragon Priest Armors for mages in each of the Skyrim armors types, cloth, light and heavy. Always paying attention to the lore and role playing of the Skyrim universe.

All cloth itens are craftable in the tailor hack in the section Dragon, and for the cloth the Dragonsmith perk is not required.
All heavy and light itens are craftable at smithing in the dragon section, dragon smithing perk is required.
All sets have different status, value and material list and are circlet friendly, at least this is an mage armor doesn't it?
Look at the pictures for further status reference.

There are both genders available, male and female (Vanilla, CBBE, UNP).

[b][u][color=#99CC00]PROJECT STATUS:[/color][/u][/b]
- Finishing model Dragon Priest Heavy Armor Male_0.
- Exclusive textures will be made by [b]CaBaL120[/b] creator of [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/18272]Bornagain skyrim steel armor[/url] and [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/19340]Bornagain skyrim iron and banded armors[/url]

[b][u][color=#99CC00]INSTALLATION:[/color][/u][/b]
[b]HOW TO INSTALL?[/b]
You can use the NMM (Nexus Mod Manager) to download and install the mod, you can download manually the files and use the NMM (Nexus Mod Manager) to install or still you can make it completely manually.
1 - Automatic - NMM Installation: Click on the button Download with Manager, wait till the end of the downloading, In the [u][b]Mod list[/b][/u] tab on NMM click twice over the Mod named "Dragon Priest Cloth Armor". Done now you can play with the version you choose.
2 - Half-Automatic - Click over the link "[b]download manually[/b]", choose a folder you will remember, on the left side of the click on the button "[b]Add Mod from File[/b]" at [u][b]Mod list[/b][/u] at NMM. Click twice over the mod to finish the installation.
3 - Manual [NOT RECOMENDED] - Click over the link "[b]download manually[/b]", choose a folder you will remember, go into the file extract it in the same folder, select and copy all folders and files you has extracted paste inside your Skyrim\Data folder.
4 - Done now just check if all ESP are checked in the [b][u]Plugins List[/u][/b] tab, select Launch Skyrim or Launch SKSE, whatever you are using and play.

[b]I WAN TO INSTALL MORE THAN ONE, IS IT POSSIBLE? HOW?[/b]
Yes, it is possible you can have all versions installed and working properly, but for that please follow the next steps:
1 - Download 2 or all 3 versions and rename it at the [u][b]Mod list[/b][/u] tab on NMM, each of them before start installing.
2 - Install the first version and at the second and third versions installation when arises an alert asking for you to replace the files, click at "[b]Yes to Folder[/b]" Button.
3 - Done now just check if all ESP are checked in the [b][u]Plugins List[/u][/b] tab, select Launch Skyrim or Launch SKSE, whatever you are using and play.
OR
1 - Install the AIO version as you would to install any other version already taught in [b]HOW TO INSTALL[/b].

[color=#FF6600]ATTENTION:[/color]
New AIO - All In One version released, if you don't has downloaded any of the standalone versions and don't crafted something from it you don't need to worry, but if you has pls read the carefully the next text.
If you are already using a standalone version, removing it and installing the AIO version will remove all Dragon Priest Armors you already has crafted, so to avoid conflicts, i'm warning you.
To fix the problem you will need use the Command Console and follow the next steps:
1 - Remove the standalone versions you are currently using
2 - Install the AIO version
3 - Start the game and enter in the Command Console by clicking the key at the left of the number 1 in the alphanumerical keyboard.
4 - type: "help dragon", click in pageup till you find the Dragon Priest Armor items with its codes that i will call here as "[DP_Armor_ID]".
5 - type: player.additem [DP_Armor_ID] 1
[b]Sorry about that, but as i have named different ESPs for each armor its impossible, at least till where my knowledge reach, to save the armors from the other ESP.[/b]

[color=#FF6600][b]So for this armor i have splited the objectives in three parts:[/b][/color]
[b][u][color=#99CC00]OBJECTIVES:[/color][/u][/b]
[b]Project 1 Objectives: Launching a playable armor[/b]
1st - Make one set of each, cloth, light and heavy armor craftable, upgradable and enchantable;
2nd - Make a Automatic open/close hood version

[b]Project 2 Objectives: Modeling Step[/b]
1st - Remake the model with covered body, gloves, boots, capes.
2nd - Make good hoods for Khajiit and Argonian Races.
3rd - Make one dragon priest armor heavy or light of each vanilla material, trying using the vanilla textures and giving it proportional status related to its crafting material like the vanilla masks already are with corresponding material textures.

[b]Project 3 Objectives: Add-on Step[/b]
1st - Make lore Dragonpriest Weapons.
2nd - Make a Enchanted version of the new dragon priest model (WIP) for Konanrik to use and to be looted and used by the player.

[center][img]http://img4.imageshack.us/img4/3290/celticseparadorsmall.jpg[/img][/center]

[b][u]Fixes, Issues and Updates:[/u][/b]

[b][ version 1.1 ][/b]
- Added AIO - All In One version, all armor versions in just one ESP.
[b][ version 1.0 ][/b]
- Minor crafting changes
- Added Heavy and Light crafting at Smithing, Dragon section, Dragon Smith Perk required.
- Added Circlet friedly version.
[b][ version 0.3 ][/b]
- Fixed NMM Crash

[b][ TO DO: Issues and Alterations: ][/b]
- Make a ONE ESP version with all armors.
- Make a Automatic open/close hood version-> Still ON Project 1
- Make a matching model for the crafting view and dropped item -> Moved TO Project 2
- Hood Hair Clipping, invisible hair -> Moved TO Project 2
- 1st person hands view fix -> Moved TO Project 2
- Version without bra -> Moved TO Project 2

[center]?????????????????????????????????????[/center]

[color=#99CC00]ITEMS LIST :[/color]
[b]Cloth Armor[/b]
- Body Cloth Armor
- Mask Cloth Armor
- Hood Cloth Armor

[b]Heavy Armor[/b]
- Body Heavy Armor
- Mask Heavy Armor
- Hood Heavy Armor

[b]Light Armor[/b]
- Body Light Armor
- Mask Light Armor
- Hood Light Armor

[center]?????????????????????????????????????[/center]

[color=#99CC00]TRANSLATIONS :[/color]
- Portuguese (Soon)

[center]?????????????????????????????????????[/center]

[color=#FF6600][u]OBSERVATIONS[/u]:[/color]
- Any grammar or any other kind of error in the text pls send me a message i will fix it. And pls understand my born language is portuguese and not english, i just make my best.
- Any doubts, issues, please feel free to send me messages and post in the mod forum thread. I will make the best to solve any problem.

[center]?????????????????????????????????????[/center]

[color=#99CC00]Mods Sugestion to work with:[/color]
- [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/15052]Apophysis Dragon Priest Masks WiP[/url] by pondcypress
- [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/17707]Open Dragon Priest Masks[/url] by calyps
